II. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; Volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry.
Description (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A (14) resides at Vista Maria. On 08/16/2023 Youth A was
visited by Foster Care Worker 2. Youth A reports that Foster Care
Worker 2 hit her. Youth A has no marks or bruising, and no other
details were known.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant X
3

On 8/18/2023 I interviewed the complainant, Youth Worker (YW)X
by telephone. YW X reported she is a youth & family worker for
Youth A at Vista Maria. She reported transporting Youth A to a
sibling visit at Ennis Center for Children (ECC) in Pontiac,
Michigan that was supervised by Oakland County Department of
Health and Human Services (DHHS) Foster Care Worker (FCW)
2. YW X reported she was not present during the sibling visit. Nor
the alleged incident of the worker hitting Youth A. Youth A told her
later, that she was hit by FCW 2. YW X reported how the latter
came to be. She reported that after dropping Youth A off for the
visit, which was supposed to be from 4:00pm- 5:00pm she left the
ECC building. She later received a text from FCW 2 around
4:30pm advising that FCW 2 was ending the visit. YW X was not
sure why the visit was ending early, but upon returning to the ECC
building, she observed Youth A’s older sister, Youth B exiting the
building followed by Youth A. As YW X advised Youth A that
Youth A could not leave, YW X heard Youth A yell to Youth B
twice, that FCW 2 hit her. Youth A did not say where she was hit.
YW X reported after getting Youth A into the van to transport her
back to Vista Maria, the person driving the vehicle that transported
Youth B to the visit, pulled up next to her. Youth A and Youth B
exchanged some words (YW X did not disclose what words were
exchanged) at that time. Youth B’s transport person, believed to
be Youth B’s grandmother, told the two youths that they could not
behave the way they had, or they will not be able to visit one
another. YW X reported it was at this point that Youth A stated, “I
know, but she hit me and that was triggering me.” At that time,
Youth A did not say who the “she” referred to. YW X offered to
speak with Youth A about what had occurred, but Youth A did not
want to talk. YW X said she completed an incident report about
the matter. YW X did not know whether Youth A had been one to
report untruths about matters. She reported during the weeks that
Youth A has been at Vista Maria, Youth A has presented as pretty
truthful, but Youth A’s past history indicates some lying behaviors.
Youth A
On 8/21/2023 I interviewed Youth A (age 14) onsite at her Vista
Maria residential facility. Youth A reported that every three weeks
she visits with her siblings at ECC-Pontiac. She reported her last
visit was on 8/16/2023 and it went okay. When I asked Youth A
whether an incident occurred between her or any of her siblings
and any of the staff at the visit, Youth A reported there was an
issue with FCW 2 and an Ennis staff person, whose name she did
not recall. Youth A said she and Youth B were arguing with the
staff. She said she and Youth B were playing around, by play
4

fighting with each other. She and Youth A were hitting each other
on their thighs, but not hard; and they were laughing and joking
around, but not loudly. FCW 2 and the Ennis staff told them to
stop a couple of times. Youth A and Youth B did not stop; and
FCW 2 ended their visit early.
Youth A denied FCW 2 or any other worker hitting her in an effort
to try to get her to stop her behavior with Youth B. When I asked
Youth A whether any worker hit or put hands on her in any fashion
at the visit on 8/16/2023, Youth A stated, “no”. When I asked
Youth A whether she ever told anyone that FCW 2 hit her, Youth
A stated, “yes”. Youth A said she had forgotten that. She said
FCW 2 did not hit her, FCW 2 pressed FCW 2’s fingers on her
right shoulder in an attempt to get her to sit down. Youth A said
there was pressure. Youth A said she did not like the pressure,
but it was not hurtful. No marks or bruises were reported from the
incident; and Youth A denied FCW 2 putting hands on her prior.
Youth A said she told FCW 2 she did not like FCW 2 putting
hands on her. She did not recall what if anything FCW 2 said to
her in response. Youth A reported the incident she described
happened just before their sibling visit was ended. They were in
the ECC agency’s hallway, and chairs were located in the hallway.
She was trying to go outside after Youth B and FCW 2 did not
want her to go outside and told her to sit down. Youth A said she
did not want to sit down, and she went outside to talk with Youth B
who had gone to Youth B’s granny’s car. Youth A denied anyone
coming after her, she said she just went to YW X’s car, and they
left.
Chief Administrator 1
On 8/22/2023 I spoke with Chief Administrator 1 about the
complaint allegation by telephone. He reported that FCW 2
denied the allegation that she put hands on the youth. He stated
FCW 2 reported there were other adults around during the
incident. Additionally, FCW 2 wrote a detailed narrative about the
incident.
Foster Care Worker 2 & Foster Supervisor 3
On 8/23/2023 I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor (FCS)3 and
FCW 2 onsite at Oakland County DHHS:
FCS 3 reported not being at the sibling visit. FCW 2 contacted her
after the visit about what had occurred. FCW 2 described the visit
as “crazy”, chaotic; that one of the teens had said FCW 2 had hit
her, and a Vista Maria staff person reported they had to call the
5

allegation in to centralize intake. FCS 3 reported during further
discussion with FCW 2 about the matter on 8/17/2023, FCW 2
reported during the children’s visit, the numerous siblings were all
displaying emotional and behavior issues, which FCW 2 and an
ECC-Pontiac worker or supervisor were trying to manage. FCS 3
said FCW 2 reported that at some point, Youth A left the visitation
room, went to the hallway and then went outside. Afterwards
Youth B came inside and said to FCW 2, “you hit my sister”; and
Youth A came in and said, “yes she did”. FCS 3 said, FCW 2
reported never hitting or touching Youth A.
FCS 3 reported Oakland County DHHS received this complaint
when it was transferred to foster care. At that time, in an effort to
follow up on the matter, as well as to safety plan, she had FCW 4
go out and complete the safety check. FCW 4 reported upon
interviewing Youth A, Youth A did not report FCW 2 hitting her.
Youth A reported FCW 2 put hands on her shoulder. FCS 3 said
FCW 2 could not recall doing that, but admitted everything was
hectic. FCS 3 denied FCW 2 having any disciplinary issues; or
there being any other complaints against FCW 2. FCS 3 could not
envision FCW 3 being physically inappropriate or hurtful to Youth
A or any youth. She stated FCW 2 goes above and beyond to help
children, her clients and coworkers.
FCW 2 denied the allegation and could not recall putting hands on
Youth A during the visitation. She affirmed information as
reported by FCS 3 about Youth A’s sibling visit being hectic and
chaotic. She, said, she and Ennis Supervisor (ES) 5 were there
during the interactions with the children; and an Ennis worker was
in and out of the visit. The children’s Guardian Ad Litem (GAL)
was also present for the visit but left when the visit was called to
an end. The GAL did not witness the later interactions.
FCW 2 reported visitation between the siblings has always been
chaotic, but during the visit on 8/16/2023 interaction between the
siblings was more difficult, they were escalated, and would not
follow directions. The therapeutic component they had added to
help with such things was not available this day due to a personal
matter coming up for the therapist. During the visit, the children
were leaving the room and wandering. Youth A had also gone
outside a couple of times; and FCW 2 had gotten her back in. All
the children were redirected to stay in the room; and Youth A and
Youth B argued with staff about the instituted boundaries. FCW 2
said Youth A and Youth B were also arguing and cursing at her
and Ennis Supervisor 5. During a part of the visit, Youth A sat on
Youth B’s lap, and the two youths began hitting each other; and
6

Youth A was also pulling Youth B’s hair. Things were getting out
of hand; and Ennis Supervisor 5 redirected the girls to stop. Youth
A and Youth B stopped temporarily, only to begin again. At one
point Youth B went outside to the parking lot and things were
calming down. Youth A also tried to go outside after Youth B.
Youth A was in the ECC lobby and FCW 2 tried to get Youth A to
sit down. FCW 2 said, she did not touch Youth A at all then. Youth
A was escalated in her tone and mannerism; and said, “I’m
triggered.” FCW 2, reported stepping back to give Youth A space
and Youth A sat down. FCW 2 reported, as she went to get Youth
A’s younger brother, Child C, Youth B came back in, and Youth A
stood up again. FCW 2 reported being concerned that the two
girls would start hitting each other again, doing what they reported
was play, but the two girls were hitting each other hard. FCW 2
reported because of that concern, she stood in between Youth A
and Youth B. She was facing Youth A, and her back was to Youth
B. Youth B stated she needed to get something (what, FCW 2 did
not say). FCW 2 told the girls, “No we are not doing this” and FCW
2 put her hand out, “sort of in between the two of them,” so that
Youth A would not get to Youth B. FCW 2 reported that is when
Youth B stated, “Why are you hitting my sister”; and Youth A
immediately responded, “yeah she is hitting me”. FCW 2 did not
recall whether she placed her hand on Youth A during this
interaction; she stated she definitely never hit Youth A.
FCW 2 reported Youth A and Youth B often try to outdo each
other in a bad way. So, when Youth B said, “why are you hitting
her”, and Youth A quickly agreed, FCW 2 did not take the matter
seriously. She did not think Youth A would have brought that up
on her own. But then YW X showed up and Youth A again stated,
“she’s hitting me, or she hit me”. FCW 2 reported at that point,
she was in the ECC doorway with YW X. She was telling Youth A
to come back inside. After that Youth A and YW X left the ECC
agency.
Ennis Receptionist 6
On 9/1/2023 I interviewed Ennis Receptionist (ER) 6 by telephone.
ER 6 was interviewed because per an email from Ennis
Administrator XX on 8/25/2023, ER 6 was at the front desk during
Youth A’s and her siblings entire visit.
ER 6 acknowledged being present at the front desk during the
visit, but stated because of how her desk was stationed, she could
not see everything. She observed Youth A and Youth B go
outside, heard both girls being loud and cursing staff; and heard
FCW 2 and ES 5 trying to deescalate Youth A. She did not see
7

FCW 2 hit or hitting Youth A. Nor did she hear Youth A say,
Youth A was hit by FCWs. ER 6 learned about the allegation from
another worker afterwards.
Ennis Supervisor 5
On 9/11/2023, I interviewed Ennis Supervisor (ES) 5 by
telephone. ES 5 acknowledged being present for Youth A and
Youth A’s siblings visit at ECC. She affirmed FCW 2 reporting
about the visit being chaotic, the children’s behaviors being
escalated, Youth A and Youth B existing the building, and she and
FCW 2’s attempts to manage the children’s behaviors and get
Youth A to come back inside. She reported during the visit, Youth
A was on top of Youth B, kicking Youth B’s face and side. Youth A
was cursing her and FCW 2 because they were redirected; and
Youth A became upset that the visit was ended early. ES 5
reported after Youth A had gone outside to the parking lot after
Youth B, she got Youth A to come back inside, but Youth A was
still agitated. Youth A was cursing and loud. FCW 2 tried to calm
Youth A down. FCW 2 put her hand on Youth A’s shoulder and
asked Youth A to sit down. Youth A complied but did not stay
sitting. ES 5 reported she was there the entire time and FCW 2
never hit Youth A. She acknowledged there was a point when
she was getting Youth A back inside the ECC building when Youth
B screamed “You let me know if they hit you”. ES 3 never heard
Youth A say, “you don’t understand she hit me.”
Documentation Review
Youth A’s MISACWIS file which showed:
• Youth A and her five siblings are Michigan Children
Institute Wards since 4/7/2023.
• Youth A has had a number of prior placements and has
been a resident at Vista Maria since 7/7/2023.
• An 8/16/2023 sibling visitation social work narrative contact
completed by FCW 2 which indicated what FCW 2 reported
when she was interviewed.
• An 8/16/2023 sibling visitation social work contact by ES 5,
which indicated “the visit was overwhelming and out of
control”; as well as information reported when ES 5 and
FCW 2 were interviewed.
Incident Report dated 8/16/2023 authored by YW X that was
actually a DHS-3200(Report of actual or suspected child
abuse or neglect) which indicated:
• During a sibling visit, Youth A made an allegation that her
DHHS worker hit her.
8

Video footage of the ECC-Pontiac visitation hallway and front
desk entrance areas which showed:
• No sound.
• Staff and children going in and out of rooms, walking up
and down a hallway.
• The front entrance door and reception area, where various
adults and children were seen coming and existing the
office or standing around.
• Youth A and Youth B at one point exiting the building,
coming back in. Adult females believed to be FCW 2 and
ES 5 going after Youth A.
• FCW 2 appearing to talk to Youth A, Youth A walking off
camera; and FCW 2 appearing to still be talking to Youth A
or someone.
• At no time was FCW 2 seen on camera putting hands on
Youth A or hitting Youth A.
Analysis Based on interviews there is no evidence to support that FCW 2
hit Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
III. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
